General intellectuals refer to individuals who have extensive knowledge and deep understanding in various fields of knowledge and topics. They tend to have a broad range of interests and can often speak or write about a wide variety of topics with good understanding. General intellectuals can integrate and connect knowledge from various disciplines to gain a more holistic insight. They usually have strong critical abilities and are committed to continuously learning and developing their knowledge.

Specialized academics refer to individuals who have very deep knowledge and expertise in a particular field. They focus on a particular field of study or discipline, and often have spent significant time studying, conducting research, and developing their understanding in that area. Specialized academics usually have higher education degrees in that specific field and can be authorities or experts in that field. They may be involved in research, publication, teaching, and various professional activities related to their specific field of study.
